definition: cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
(negative prefix)/not/no
accustomed to/used to/indulge/to spoil (a child)

sentences.english: And they might frown upon our behavior.
sentences.chinese: 他們可能會看不慣我們的行爲。

sentences.english: SunQiMing cannot bear to see, he came near and comfort on the girl.
sentences.chinese: 孫啓鳴看不慣，於是上前安慰起那個女孩。

sentences.english: You know how I hate people who bawl all the time.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我就看不慣那種成天嚷嚷嚷的人。

sentences.english: She just really rubs me the wrong way. And you know what?
sentences.chinese: 對她我總是看不慣，你知道嗎？

sentences.english: I hate to see his weak personality that makes him simply turn the other cheek.
sentences.chinese: 看不慣他這種唾面自乾的懦弱性格。

sentences.english: I get so sick at the whole thing at times I want to quit.
sentences.chinese: 我對當前的情況實在看不慣，有時真想不幹了。

sentences.english: Of people could not understand, Chavez does not always seem to leave some feelings to each other.
sentences.chinese: 對看不慣的人，查韋斯似乎總是不給對方留一點情面。

sentences.english: I hate to see these old customs.
They have all come head to head with the flaws of the education system.
sentences.chinese: 因爲看不慣教育體制的弊端，他們走到了一起。

sentences.english: You know what you like, and have little patience for that which offends you.
sentences.chinese: 你深知自己的喜好，對看不慣的東西難以忍受。

sentences.english: Oh, and I always wear an earring- some of the older guys don’t like it.
sentences.chinese: 啊，我總是帶着耳環，一些年歲大的人看不慣它。

sentences.english: She constantly abused her adopted son for no reason. Even the neighbors couldn't stand it.
sentences.chinese: 她經常無緣無故詬詈養子，鄰居們都看不慣了。

sentences.english: What I hate is the way he's always rubbing his hand together, "Washing his hands with invisible soap and imperceptible water."
sentences.chinese: 我看不慣的是他那總是忸怩作態地搓手的樣子。

sentences.english: People always hold this abominable behaviour in detestation.
sentences.chinese: 這種惡劣作風一向叫人看不慣。

definition: to dislike/to loathe/disagreeable/troublesome/annoying
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to loathe/to hate/disgusted with sth
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
stingy/miserly/narrow-minded/petty
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
unpleasant talk/malicious words
delicate/squeamish/finicky
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
to annoy/annoying/irritating/troublesome
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to involve/to implicate/to be interrelated
to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
to have nothing to say (idiom)
